title: Nepal open Premier Cup with hard-fought win - The Kathmandu Post
description: Nepal open Premier Cup with hard-fought win  The Kathmandu Post
publisher.title: The Kathmandu Post
full_article:
Nepal launched their bid for the 2025 Asia Cup with a hard-fought five-wicket victory over Malaysia in their opening match of the 2024 ACC Men’s Premier Cup at the Al Amerat Cricket Ground in Al Amerat, Oman on Friday.

Chasing 144, the defending champions Nepal achieved the target in 19.2 overs losing five wickets, but had to survive some scare from the Malaysians late in the innings.

Despite starting a clear favourites, the Rhinos had a slow start to their innings managing just 59 runs from the first ten overs and it almost proved costly when Malaysia captain Virandeep Singh got the prized wickets of dangermen Rohit Paudel and Dipendra Singh Airee in the 17th over.

But Gulsan Jha played a game-changing 7-ball 19 to snatch victory from the jaws of defeat.

Nepal started at snail’s pace scoring just 49 runs from the first eight overs, with openers Kushal Bhurtel making 24 runs off 24 balls and Aasif Sheikh scoring 32 runs from 35 balls.

Pavandeep Singh found the first breakthrough when he trapped Bhurtel leg before in the 7.5 overs. Virandeep next removed Sheikh in the 11.1 overs, and Kushal Malla soon walked back adding a cheap 7.

Captain Rohit Paudel and Dipendra Singh Airee instilled some smoothness in Nepal’s run-flow but Virandeep hit back taking the quick wickets of Paudel and Airee to put Nepal in trouble.

Paudel reached his 1000 T20I run landmark in the 9.1 over—joining Deependra Singh Airee and Kushal Bhurtel and becoming the third Nepali batter to achieve the milestone, before departing back making 27 runs off 24 balls in the 16.1 overs, caught by Muniandy.

Paudel has scored 1023 T20I runs from his 42 innings.

Singh then gave Nepal a scare removing Airee, who made 20 runs off 11 balls, in the 16.6 overs.

But Jha held his nerve.

With Nepal needing 30 runs from the last three overs, Jha and Sundeep Jora put everything at stake to add 13 runs in the 18th over.

Jha then hammered a six and a four off Virandeep in the 19th over to guide Nepal past the target.

Jora scored 12 runs off nine balls.

Virandeep took 3-35, while Pavandeep and Muhammad Wafiq picked one wicket each.

Earlier, Malaysia opted to bat first and posted 143-3 from their 20 overs with the help of a half-century from captain Virandeep.

After Airee ended Amar Azim’s slow knock of 18-ball 16 in the powerplay, Singh added 82 runs with Sharvin Muniandy for the second wicket to power the Malaysians to an average total.

Singh was unconquered on 72 runs. His 57-ball knock featured four boundaries and four sixes.

Muniandy, who was bowled by Abinash Bohara in the 16.1 overs, scored 41 runs facing 33 deliveries.

Airee took two wickets for Nepal.

Nepal play their next group match against Qatar on Saturday.

Nepal are pitted alongside Malaysia, Qatar, Hong Kong and and Saudi Arabia in Group A. Group B consists of Bahrain, Cambodia, Kuwait, Oman and the UAE.

The top two teams from each group will advance to the semi-finals, which will be played on April 19.

The final will take place on April 21.

The winners will book their ticket to the next year’s Asia Cup.

Hosts Oman, the United Arab Emirates and Hong Kong also won their opening matches of the Premier Cup.

Oman beat Bahrain by three runs, UAE saw off Kuwait by seven wickets and Hong Kong won against Qatar by 26 runs.

title: Nepal celebrates New Year’s Day as per Bikram era - The Week
description: Nepal celebrates New Year’s Day as per Bikram era  The Week
publisher.title: The Week
full_article:
Kathmandu, Apr 13 (PTI) Nepal on Saturday celebrated New Year’s Day according to the traditional Bikram Sambat 2081 calendar with much fanfare, with tourists and pilgrims thronging scenic spots and temples in the Himalayan nation.

The Bikram era or Sambat is named after Indian King Bikramaditya and this is the official calendar in Nepal.

On Saturday, the first day of Baisakh as per the Nepalese calendar, people are celebrating New Year’s Day with fanfare across the country.

To celebrate the Nepalese New Year, people clean their houses, prepare delicious cuisine and visit temples to celebrate. There was a big rush in Pashupatinath and other temples in and around Kathmandu on the day.

Restaurants, bars, nightclubs, picnic spots, temples, hill stations, and various other public places in and around Kathmandu are jam-packed.

President Ramchandra Poudel, extending a message of best wishes on the occasion, said, “Our efforts should be for achieving a sufficient and sustainable economy through the development of national capital by promoting domestic production and development of entrepreneurship.”

Prime Minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal ‘Prachanda’ in his message vowed to create a strong base for developing the nation through economic reforms.

“The ultimate goal of all Nepalis is to bring prosperity and elevate the nation’s image through promoting unity, mutual cooperation and harmonious feeling,” he said.

Meanwhile, the Nepal government has lifted the time restrictions in Thamel and Durbarmarg, the tourist hubs of Kathmandu, starting from New Year’s Day to promote tourism.

“All tourism-related outlets, including restaurants, night clubs, dance bars and discos will remain open round the clock starting from Saturday,” a notice issued by the local authority said.

full_article:
In an insightful analysis of Nepal’s aviation sector, Simrik Air has embarked on a strategic initiative to enrich and promote helicopter tourism by unveiling its inaugural magazine titled “Helicopter Nepal”. This publication is set to serve as a cornerstone in broadcasting best practices, celebrating industry achievements, and solidifying Nepal’s stature as a top heli-tourism spot.

Helicopters serve as a crucial means of access to Nepal’s hard-to-reach destinations and a thrilling element for tourists seeking to experience the country’s majestic landscapes from above. “Helicopter Nepal” magazine fulfills a need for an informed platform that represents the array of views and experiences within the Nepalese helicopter community. Its comprehensive annual issues are expected to provide professional insight into industry trends, safety, economic challenges, and conversation on environmental impact.

As the global market for helicopter services accelerates, driven by technological advancements and a growing demand for emergency medical services, Nepal’s unique geographical appeal for aerial excursions places it in a prime position for growth. The new magazine’s debut is timely, aligning with market dynamics while aspiring to be a critical informational repository for those directly or indirectly involved with helicopters in Nepal.

With sustainability in mind, “Helicopter Nepal” not only reflects on the sector’s strides and hurdles but also commits to involving its stakeholders in discussions about preserving the natural environment alongside helicopter operations. Simrik Air’s pioneering effort with this magazine marks an essential step in supporting a more knowledge-driven and cohesive helicopter community in Nepal, paralleling the global discourse on industry growth through informed engagement and responsible practices.

In the context of broader industry commentary, the magazine is expected to act as a vital pulse on both regulatory challenges and technological innovations, guiding Nepal’s helicopter sector toward global competitiveness and excellence.

To stay updated on helicopter service trends and global insights, industry enthusiasts can consult leading websites such as Helicopter Association International or Vertical Magazine for professional resources and news. However, please verify the URLs before accessing these online resources.

Industry Overview

The helicopter tourism industry, particularly in regions like Nepal, plays a significant role in the overall aviation sector. Known for its rugged terrain and breath-taking scenery, Nepal has positioned itself as a premier destination for adventurers and tourists who wish to see the world’s highest peaks up close. Helicopters provide essential services in areas that are otherwise inaccessible due to the lack of road infrastructure or challenges of the terrain.

Market Forecasts

The global helicopter market is expected to experience steady growth over the next decade. Market research suggests that the demand for helicopter tourism will continue to rise, driven by increasing disposable income, a surge in tourism activities, and the quest for unique travel experiences. High-profile events, improved safety records, and the development of new routes in scenic areas contribute positively to the market outlook.

Industry Challenges

However, with growth comes the responsibility to address several challenges facing the helicopter tourism sector. These include concerns about the environmental impact, with noise and emissions affecting wildlife and the ecosystem. Safety is also paramount, with the need for enhanced pilot training, maintenance standards, and improved weather forecasting systems. Moreover, the regulatory environment requires careful navigation, ensuring compliance with local and international aviation laws and standards.

Operational costs for helicopter companies remain high, and this impacts pricing for consumers, potentially limiting market access. Economic fluctuations and geopolitical tensions can also affect tourism patterns and, by extension, the demand for helicopter services.

Environmental and Sustainability Issues

As the industry continues to expand, sustainability practices are becoming increasingly important. Companies like Simrik Air are engaging stakeholders in discussions on how to preserve the natural beauty of Nepal while still providing high-quality helicopter services. The potential for initiatives such as using lower-emission fuels, designing quieter rotor technologies, and implementing flight operations that minimize disruption to wildlife, are all topics that may be covered within “Helicopter Nepal” and the broader industry conversation.

Global Discourse and Opportunities

Nepal’s helicopter sector can benefit significantly from technological innovations, such as the exploitation of electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft for reducing carbon footprints. There is also the possibility of adopting advanced air mobility systems that could re-shape accessibility in remote regions. Further, the expansion of emergency medical services and search and rescue operations using helicopters represents another growth area with a profound impact on society.

To aid in the knowledge and best practice sharing, industry operators and enthusiasts can visit globally recognized platforms such as the Helicopter Association International or the Vertical Magazine to stay informed about the latest industry developments, gaining insights into how to navigate the sector’s challenges and opportunities effectively. These resources can be invaluable in supporting Nepal’s helicopter community in achieving global competitiveness and operational excellence.

बढ़ावा दै के रणनीतिक पहल शुरू करलकै ।ई प्रकाशन सर्वोत्तम प्रथा के प्रसारण, उद्योग के उपलब्धि के जश्न मनाबै, आरू नेपाल के कद क॑ शीर्ष हेली-टूरिज्म स्पॉट के रूप म॑ ठोस बनाबै म॑ एक आधारशिला के रूप म॑ काम करै लेली तैयार छै ।हेलीकॉप्टर नेपाल केरऽ मुश्किल स॑ चलै वाला गंतव्यऽ म॑ पहुँच के एगो महत्वपूर्ण साधन के रूप म॑ काम करै छै आरू ऊपर स॑ देश केरऽ राजसी परिदृश्य के अनुभव करै के कोशिश करै वाला पर्यटकऽ लेली एगो रोमांचक तत्व के रूप म॑ काम करै छै ।“हेलीकॉप्टर नेपाल” पत्रिका एकटा सूचित मंच के जरूरत पूरा करै छै जे नेपाली हेलीकॉप्टर समुदाय के भीतर दृश्य आरू अनुभव के सरणी के प्रतिनिधित्व करै छै.एकरऽ व्यापक वार्षिक मुद्दा स॑ पर्यावरणीय प्रभाव प॑ उद्योग केरऽ रुझान, सुरक्षा, आर्थिक चुनौती, आरू बातचीत के पेशेवर जानकारी मिलै के उम्मीद छै ।जेना-जेना हेलीकॉप्टर सेवा केरऽ वैश्विक बाजार म॑ तेजी आबै छै, तकनीकी उन्नति आरू आपातकालीन चिकित्सा सेवा केरऽ बढ़तऽ मांग स॑ संचालित, नेपाल केरऽ हवाई भ्रमण लेली अद्वितीय भौगोलिक अपील एकरा विकास लेली एगो प्रमुख स्थिति म॑ रखै छै ।नयका पत्रिका केरऽ शुरुआत समय पर छै, जेकरा म॑ बाजार गतिशीलता के साथ संरेखित छै जबकि नेपाल म॑ हेलीकॉप्टरऽ के साथ प्रत्यक्ष या परोक्ष रूप स॑ जुड़लऽ लोगऽ लेली एगो महत्वपूर्ण सूचनात्मक भंडार के आकांक्षा छै ।स्थायित्व क॑ ध्यान म॑ रखतें हुअ॑ “हेलीकॉप्टर नेपाल” न॑ न सिर्फ क्षेत्र केरऽ प्रगति आरू बाधा क॑ चिंतन करै छै बल्कि हेलीकॉप्टर परिचालन के साथ-साथ प्राकृतिक वातावरण क॑ संरक्षित करै के बारे म॑ चर्चा म॑ अपनऽ हितधारकऽ क॑ शामिल करै के प्रतिबद्धता जतैन॑ छै ।सिमुरिक एयर केरऽ ई पत्रिका के साथ अग्रणी प्रयास नेपाल म॑ अधिक ज्ञान-संचालित आरू समन्वित हेलीकॉप्टर समुदाय के समर्थन करै म॑ एगो आवश्यक कदम के संकेत दै छै, जेकरा म॑ सूचित संलग्नता आरू जिम्मेदार प्रथा के माध्यम स॑ उद्योग केरऽ विकास प॑ वैश्विक प्रवचन के समानांतर छै ।व्यापक उद्योग टिप्पणी के संदर्भ म॑ पत्रिका क॑ नियामक चुनौती आरू तकनीकी नवाचारो दूनू प॑ एगो महत्वपूर्ण दाल के रूप म॑ काम करै के उम्मीद छै, जेकरा स॑ नेपाल केरऽ हेलीकॉप्टर क्षेत्र क॑ वैश्विक प्रतिस्पर्धा आरू उत्कृष्टता के तरफ मार्गदर्शन करलऽ जाय सक॑ ।हेलीकॉप्टर सेवा रुझान आरू वैश्विक अंतर्दृष्टि के बारे म॑ अपडेट रह॑ लेली उद्योग केरऽ उत्साही लोगऽ क॑ पेशेवर संसाधन आरू समाचार लेली हेलीकॉप्टर एसोसिएशन इंटरनेशनल या ऊर्ध्वाधर पत्रिका जैसनऽ प्रमुख वेबसाइटऽ स॑ परामर्श करी सकै छै ।मुदा, कृपया एहि ऑनलाइन संसाधनक उपयोग करबा सं पहिने यूआरएल कें सत्यापन करू.उद्योग अवलोकन हेलीकॉप्टर पर्यटन उद्योग, विशेष रूप स॑ नेपाल जैसनऽ क्षेत्रऽ म॑, समग्र विमानन क्षेत्र म॑ महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाबै छै ।अपनऽ उबड़-खाबड़ इलाका आरू सांस लेबऽ वाला दृश्य लेली जानलऽ जाय वाला नेपाल न॑ खुद क॑ साहसिक आरू पर्यटकऽ लेली एगो प्रमुख गंतव्य के रूप म॑ स्थापित करल॑ छै जे दुनिया केरऽ उच्चतम चोटी क॑ नजदीक स॑ देखै के इच्छा रखै छै ।हेलीकॉप्टर सड़क बुनियादी ढाँचा या इलाका के चुनौती के कमी के कारण अन्यथा दुर्गम छै, जे अन्यथा दुर्गम छै.बाजार केरऽ पूर्वानुमान वैश्विक हेलीकॉप्टर बाजार म॑ अगिला दशक म॑ लगातार विकास के अनुभव होय के उम्मीद छै ।बाजार अनुसंधान स॑ पता चलै छै कि हेलीकॉप्टर पर्यटन केरऽ मांग बढ़त॑ रहतै, जेकरा म॑ डिस्पोजेबल आय म॑ वृद्धि, पर्यटन गतिविधियऽ म॑ उछाल, आरू अद्वितीय यात्रा अनुभव के खोज होय क॑ संचालित होतै ।उच्च प्रोफाइल आयोजन, बेहतर सुरक्षा रिकॉर्ड, आरू मनोरम क्षेत्रऽ म॑ नया मार्गऽ के विकास बाजार केरऽ दृष्टिकोण म॑ सकारात्मक योगदान दै छै ।उद्योग चुनौती हालांकि, विकास के जिम्मेदारी छै हेलीकॉप्टर पर्यटन क्षेत्र के सामने आबै वाला कई चुनौती के संबोधित करै के.अइ मे पर्यावरणीय प्रभाव कें बारे मे चिंता शामिल छै, जइ मे शोर आ उत्सर्जन वन्यजीव आ पारिस्थितिकी तंत्र कें प्रभावित करएयत छै.सुरक्षा भी सर्वोपरि छै, जेकरा म॑ पायलट प्रशिक्षण, रखरखाव के मानक, आरू बेहतर मौसम पूर्वानुमान प्रणाली के जरूरत छै.एतबे नहि, नियामक वातावरण मे सावधानीपूर्वक नेविगेशन कें आवश्यकता छै, जे स्थानीय आ अंतर्राष्ट्रीय विमानन कानून आ मानक कें अनुपालन सुनिश्चित करय छै.हेलीकॉप्टर कंपनीक कें लेल परिचालन लागत बेसि रहयत छै, आ इ उपभोक्ताअक कें लेल मूल्य निर्धारण कें प्रभावित करयत छै, जे संभावित रूप सं बाजार कें पहुंच कें सीमित करयत छै.आर्थिक उतार-चढ़ाव आरू भू-राजनीतिक तनाव पर्यटन पैटर्न आरू विस्तार स॑ हेलीकॉप्टर सेवा केरऽ मांग क॑ भी प्रभावित करी सकै छै ।पर्यावरण आ स्थायित्व मुद्दा जेना-जेना उद्योग कें विस्तार जारी होयत छै, स्थायित्व प्रथाक कें महत्व बढ़ी रहल छै.सिमरिक एयर जैसनऽ कंपनी न॑ नेपाल केरऽ प्राकृतिक सौंदर्य क॑ कोना संरक्षित करलऽ जाय, एकरा लेली चर्चा म॑ हितधारकऽ क॑ शामिल करी रहलऽ छै जबकि अभी भी उच्च गुणवत्ता वाला हेलीकॉप्टर सेवा प्रदान करै छै ।निम्न उत्सर्जन ईंधन के उपयोग, शांत रोटर प्रौद्योगिकी के डिजाइन, आरू वन्यजीवऽ म॑ व्यवधान क॑ कम स॑ कम करै वाला उड़ान परिचालन क॑ लागू करै के पहल के संभावना, ई सब विषय छै जेकरा “हेलीकॉप्टर नेपाल” आरू व्यापक उद्योग के बातचीत के भीतर कवर करलऽ जाय सकै छै ।वैश्विक प्रवचन आरू अवसर नेपाल केरऽ हेलीकॉप्टर क्षेत्र क॑ तकनीकी नवाचारो स॑ काफी फायदा मिल॑ सकै छै, जेना कि कार्बन पदचिह्न क॑ कम करै लेली इलेक्ट्रिक full_article:
Nepal batter Dipendra Singh Airee became only the third batter in history to hit six sixes in an over in T20 Internationals when he achieved the feat during his side's ACC Men's Premier Cup clash against Qatar in Al Amerat. Airee unleashed a stunning onslaught against Kamran Khan in the final over of the innings, amassing an impressive 36 runs in the seventh match of the ACC Men’s Premier Cup at the AI Amerat Cricket Ground in Oman. Airee joined India great Yuvraj Singh, who first set this record during the inaugural T20 World Cup in 2007 against England, and West Indies T20 legend Kieron Pollard. Airee, starting the over at 28 off 15 balls with Nepal at 174 for 7, unleashed a barrage of sixes against medium pacer Kamran Khan, propelling his score to 64 from 21 deliveries and driving Nepal's total to 210 for 7. This achievement placed Airee alongside the likes of Yuvraj Singh and Kieron Pollard, who had achieved this milestone previously in T20 internationals. In the realm of ODI cricket, Herschelle Gibbs and USA's Jaskaran Malhotra are among those who have accomplished this feat.

title: Nepal's Yuvraj Singh: Meet Dipendra Singh Airee, third batter to hit six sixes in a T20I over - The Week
description: Nepal's Yuvraj Singh: Meet Dipendra Singh Airee, third batter to hit six sixes in a T20I over  The Week

full_article:
Nepal's Dipendra Singh Airee, the batter who has scored the fastest T20I fifty in history, on Saturday became only the third man to hit six sixes in an over in a T20I match.

The right-handed batter, who is Nepal's versatile finisher, achieved the feat in the last over against Qatar in their ACC Men's Premier Cup match in Oman's Al Amerat. India's Yuvraj Singh and Caribbean Kieron Pollard are the only two other players to achieve the feat in the game's shortest format.

It was Qatar's seam bowler Kamran Khan who was at the receiving end of Airee's onslaught, ESPNCricInfo said in a report. The 36-run last over resulted in Nepal crossing the 200 mark and Airee registering a half-century. At the end of the penultimate over, the Asian side were 174-7 with Airee on 28 runs from 15 balls. The six sixes meant Nepal finished the innings 210-7 while Airee remained unbeaten on 64 from 21.

 ‍#NEPvQAT #ACCMensPremierCup #ACC pic.twitter.com/72Itd5INE1 — AsianCricketCouncil (@ACCMedia1) April 13, 2024

24-year-old Dipendra Singh Airee has played 60 T20Is and 55 ODIs for Nepal. The experienced campaigner is no stranger to explosive batting. When his teammate Kushal Malla went on to score a record-shattering 34-ball hundred against Mongolia during the Hangzhou Asian Games in 2023, Airee had also joined the party by hitting six consecutive maximums across two overs, the ESPNCricInfo report pointed out. The innings witnessed Airee reaching the 50-run mark in just nine balls -- the fastest T20I fifty to date.

Iconic Indian all-rounder Yuvraj Singh was the first player ever to smash six maximums in an over. The famous innings came against England during the 2007 T20 World Cup. It was Stuart Broad, then a rookie, was was hammered by the stylish left-hander. Kieron Pollard also achieved the unique feat when he took on Sri Lanka's Akila Dananjaya in 2021. In the ODI format, South Africa great Herschelle Gibbs and USA's Jaskaran Malhotra have managed to do so against Netherlands and Papua New Guinea respectively.

Airee was on 28 off 15 balls before the start of the final over of the innings against Kamran Khan. He went on to hit every ball of the last over for six to finish on 64 off 21 balls.

The Nepal star player came through the 2016 ICC Men's U19 Cricket World Cup in 2016 and got into the senior team by the age of 17.

Interestingly, last year, Airee hit six consecutive sixes in the Asian Games against Mongolia, but then the feat was spread across two overs when he smashed the fastest fifty in T20Is in nine balls, breaking Yuvraj Singh's record of 12 deliveries.

Airee's form is a huge boost for Nepal with less than 50 days to go for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2024. Nepal are in Group D alongside South Africa, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh and the Netherlands in the marquee tournament, hosted in the Caribbean Islands and USA.

title: 6,6,6,6,6,6 In 1 Over: Nepal Star Dipendra Singh Airee Emulates Yuvraj Singh, Achieves Historic Firs.. - NDTV Sports
description: 6,6,6,6,6,6 In 1 Over: Nepal Star Dipendra Singh Airee Emulates Yuvraj Singh, Achieves Historic Firs..  NDTV Sports
publisher.title: NDTV Sports
full_article:
Nepal's Dipendra Singh Airee etched his name in history books as he hit six sixes in an over in a T20I against Qatar in the ongoing ACC premier Cup 2024. He is now the third cricketer after India's Yuvraj Singh and West Indies Kieron Pollard to slam six sixes in an over in T20Is. He is also the first ever cricketer to hit six sixes in six consecutive balls in T20Is twice. At the Asian Games 2023, Airee also smashed 6 successive sixes in a game against Mongolia, although the feat came over two different overs.

Coming to bat at No. 5, Airee scored 64* off 21 balls with his innings including seven sixes and three fours. The over in which he hit six sixes came against Kamran Khan. Nepal reached 210/7 in 20 overs against Qatar, who struggled with the bat too.

Earlier at the Asian Games 2023, Airee was part of a record-breaking display.

In the match against Mongolia, Nepal batters smashed three different world records in an Asian Games 2023 match. While most batters managed to score runs effortlessly, the man who shone the most was Dipendra Singh, having scored 6 consecutive fifties, en route fastest T20I fifty in international cricket. Nepal went on to post a 300-plus total in the game, becoming the first team in the history of the sport to score 314/3 in 20 overs.

Kushal Malla, a 19-year-old left-handed batter, struck the fastest-ever T20I hundred in the history of the game, reaching the triple-digit score in 34 balls. In the process, he surpassed David Miller and Rohit Sharma's joint record. The South African and Indian batters had scored fifty in 35 balls previously.

Batting at No 3, Malla smashed 12 sixes and eight fours to remain unbeaten on 137 and power Nepal to the highest-ever T20I score of 314 for 3 against Mongolia, who opted to field.

publisher.title: The Hindu
full_article:
Nepal's hard-hitting Dipendra Singh Airee became the third batter to smash six sixes in an over in T20 internationals in Al Amerat on April 13.

Airee achieved the feat against hosts Qatar during the ongoing ACC Men's Premier Cup T20 International fixture in Al Amerat.

ICYMI: 6️⃣6️⃣6️⃣6️⃣6️⃣6️⃣



Here's how @DSAiree45 scored Six Sixes in a row being the first Nepali batter to do it so.



 @ACCMedia1#NepalCricket | #NEPvQATpic.twitter.com/LjHFGmxIf1 — CAN (@CricketNep) April 13, 2024

Thus, Airee joined an elite company of Yuvraj Singh (against Stuart Broad during T20 World Cup 2007) and Kieron Pollard (against Sri Lanka's Akila Dananjaya in 2021) as batters with six maximums in one over.

The 24-year-old Airee remained unbeaten on a 21-ball 64 that included three fours and seven sixes at a monstrous strike rate 304.76.

Aasif Sheikh made 52 as Nepal posted 210 for seven. They had already beaten Malaysia by five wickets in the opening match on Friday.

Airee puts up a show at Oman as he blasts his way to the fifty milestone with six sixes in the final over 



 Catch the action live: https://t.co/S7L9VIEkpK



: ACC#ACCMensPremierCup2024 | #WorldCupYear2024 | #OneBallBattles | #NepalCricket

In fact, the Nepal man became the fifth batsman to achieve this rare feat in international cricket, with Herschelle Gibbs of South Africa and USA's Jaskaran Malhotra completing it in ODIs earlier.

However, Airee is no stranger to hitting six sixes. During Nepal's Hangzhou Asian Games T20I clash against Mongolia in September last year, he had pummeled six consecutive sixes across two overs.

That match also saw Nepal posting a world-record 314 for three before bowling out the opponent for 41.

title: Janakpurdham Cultural Festival celebrates Nepali New Year with music and food - Myrepublica
description: Janakpurdham Cultural Festival celebrates Nepali New Year with music and food  Myrepublica
publisher.title: Myrepublica
full_article:
KATHMANDU, April 13: The 2nd edition of the Janakpurdham Cultural Festival was held on April 13, 2024, coinciding with the Nepali New Year 2081 BS. Organized by the Swami Vivekananda Cultural Centre (SVCC), Embassy of India in Kathmandu, in collaboration with the Consulate General of India, Birgunj, and the BP Koirala India-Nepal Foundation, the festival took place at the Mahendranarayan Nidhi Mithila Cultural Center in Janakpur.

The festival featured two sessions, starting with a keynote address on ‘Jaanaki Lila’ by Haribans Jha, exhibitions on sarees and the forts of India and Nepal, and a Maithili Food Festival curated by chef Santosh Sah. The evening session included musical performances based on the life of Lord Ram and Sita, and a special performance by Nepali singer and Indian Idol 2024 top 10 contestant, Menuka Poudel.

The event was inaugurated by Saroj Kumar Yadav, Chief Minister of Madhesh Province, with Manoj Kumar Sah, Mayor of Janakpurdham Sub-Metropolitan City, serving as the chief guest for the evening. The festival was attended by Provincial Assembly members of Madhesh Province, dignitaries, the media, and a large audience, celebrating the shared cultural heritage of India and Nepal.

title: Nepal batter Dipendra Singh Airee hits six sixes in an over; becomes third player to achieve feat in T20Is - WION
description: Nepal batter Dipendra Singh Airee hits six sixes in an over; becomes third player to achieve feat in T20Is  WION
publisher.title: WION
full_article:
Nepal's Dipendra Singh Airee has created history by becoming the third player to hit six sixes in an over of an international T20I. The Nepal batter reached the feat against Qatar on April 13 in Asian Cricket Council (ACC) Men's Premier Cup match. Airee reached the milestone in 20th over of Nepal's innings against Qatar's Kamran Khan.

Airee, who was at 28 off 15 before the start of the final over, eventually finished with 21-ball 64 as Nepal posted 210/7 in 20 overs. He now has entered the list with India's Yuvraj Singh and West Indies' Kieron Pollard, who also have hit six sixes in an over in a T20I.

Also Read: Former India opener backs Rajasthan Royals batter Riyan Parag to be in T20 World Cup squad

Yuvraj had hit England's Stuart Broad for six sixes during the inaugural T20 World Cup in 2007 while Pollard had smashed Sri Lanka's Akila Dananjaya in 2021. Overall, Airee is the fifth player to hit six sixes in an over in an international match.

Apart from the above three, South Africa's Herschelle Gibbs and the USA's Jaskaran Malhotra have also achieved the feat, albeit in ODIs.

Airee is not new to making records, he had also hit the fastest fifty in T20Is last year during the Asian Games as well. Batting against Mongolia, Airee scored 52 not out off just 9 balls - the minimum required to hit a fifty. He had hit six sixes in a row in that match as well, but they were spread across two overs. Nepal had also posted a record 314/3 - the first 300-plus total in T20Is.

As for the match against Qatar, Nepal restricted the opposition for 178/9 and won the match by 32 runs. For Qatar, skipper Muhammad Tanveer top scored with 33-ball 63.
translated: नेपाल केरऽ डिपेंद्र सिंह एरी न॑ एगो अंतर्राष्ट्रीय टी-२०आई केरऽ ओवर के दौरान छह छक्का मार॑ वाला तेसरऽ खिलाड़ी बनी क॑ इतिहास के निर्माण करलकै ।नेपाल केरऽ बल्लेबाज १३ अप्रैल क॑ एशियाई क्रिकेट काउंसिल (एसीसी) केरऽ पुरुष प्रीमियर कप मैच म॑ कतार के खिलाफ कारनामा प॑ पहुँचलै ।कतार के कमरन खान के खिलाफ नेपाल के पारी के 20वां ओवर में एरी मील के पत्थर पर पहुंच गेल.फाइनल ओवर केरऽ शुरुआत स॑ पहल॑ 28 रन प॑ 28 रन प॑ छेलै, अंततः 21-बॉल 64 के साथ समाप्त होय गेलै, कैन्हेंकि नेपाल न॑ 20 ओवर म॑ 210/7 दर्ज करलकै ।आब ओ भारत के युवराज सिंह आ वेस्टइंडीज के कियरोन पोलार्ड के संग एहि सूची मे प्रवेश केने छथि, जे एकटा टी-20आई मे छह छक्का के ओवर मे सेहो हिट केने छथिन्ह.साथ ही पढ़ें: भारत ओपनर के पूर्व बैक्स राजस्थान रॉयल्स बैटर रियान पैराग 1007 में उद्घाटन टी-20 विश्व कप के दौरान छह छक्का के लेल इंग्लैंड के स्टुअर्ट ब्रॉड के टक्कर मारने छल जखन कि पोलार्ड श्रीलंका के अकिला के दानाजाय के 2021 में तोड़ि देने छल. इंटरनेशनल मैच म॑ ओवर म॑ छह छक्का मार॑ वाला पाँचमऽ खिलाड़ी छै ।उपरोक्त तीनों के अलावा दक्षिण अफ्रीका के हर्शेल गिब्स आरू अमेरिका के जस्करन मल्होत्रा ​​न॑ भी ओडीई म॑ ई करतब हासिल करलकै ।एरी रिकॉर्ड बनाबै लेली नया नै छै, वू पिछला साल एशियाई खेल के दौरान भी टी-२० में सबसें तेज पचास के हिट करलकै ।मंगोलिया के खिलाफ बल्लेबाजी करतें हुअ॑ एरी न॑ 52 गोल नै करलकै जेकरा म॑ महज 9 गेंद नै मिललै - जेकरा स॑ एक पचास के हिट करै लेली जरूरी छेलै ।ओहि मैच मे सेहो ओ लगातार छह छक्का मारने छलाह, मुदा ओ सभ दू ओवर मे पसरल छल.नेपाल न॑ भी रिकॉर्ड 314/3 - टी-20आईएस म॑ पहिलऽ 300-प्लस कुल दर्ज करलकै ।रहल बात कतार के खिलाफ मैच के त नेपाल 178/9 के लेल विपक्ष के प्रतिबंधित क 32 रन सं मैच जीत लेलक।कतार के लेल कप्तान मुहम्मद टैनवीर टॉप 33 बॉल 63 के संग गोल केलनि।

title: Airee makes history as Nepal register second Premier Cup victory - The Kathmandu Post
description: Airee makes history as Nepal register second Premier Cup victory  The Kathmandu Post
publisher.title: The Kathmandu Post
full_article:
Nepal registered their second win in the ongoing 2024 ACC Men’s Premier Cup after defeating Qatar by 32 runs at the Al Amerat Cricket Ground in Al Amerat, Oman on Saturday.



Opting to bat first, the Rhinos had accumulated a total of 210 runs as Dipendra Singh Airee posted an unbeaten half-century, which featured a record six maximums in a single over.

In reply, the defending champions limited Qatar to 178 in the stipulated 20 overs.

Earlier, Nepal were off to a slow start losing opener Kushal Bhurtel for a cheap 11-ball 12 after Qatar’s Amar Farooq had him caught by Kamran Khan in 2.5 overs.

Captain Rohit Paudel was next to go, being caught by Muhammad Tanveer off Himanshu Rathod. Paudel faced 17 deliveries and contributed 18 runs.

Another opener and wicketkeeper Aasif Sheikh and Kushal Malla brought a 53-run partnership before Malla was dismissed in 13.5 overs. He smashed two hits to the fences and three maximums, scoring 35 runs in his 18-knock play.

Sheikh cracked a half-century to contribute 52 off 41 balls before being caught by Muhammad Tanveer off Himanshu Rathod in 14.2 overs.

Airee demonstrated a remarkable batting show as he put an unbeaten 64 runs on the scoreboard. The half-century featured three hits to the fences and seven maximums, of which six were fired in just the final over of the innings.

In doing so, Airee became the first Nepali player to ever achieve the rare feat.

He joined Yuvraj Singh of India and Kieron Pollard of West Indies to become the third batter to achieve the feat in Men's T20Is.

Qatar lost wickets in quick succession as most batters failed to score in double digits.

Opener Saqlain Arshad was dismissed for a single run in just the third delivery of the innings while Mohammad Ahnaff was also caught for an 18-ball 23 in 4.6 overs.

Another opener Kamran Khan was next to go, being bowled out by Gulshan Jha for 18 runs.

Qatar captain Muhammad Tanveer brought some stability to innings as he put 63 runs in 33 deliveries. Tanveer muscled six hits to the fences and four maximums.

Himanshu Rathod (22*) and Mirza Adnan Ali (19) were the only other batters to post double-digit scores for Qatar.

For Nepal, Dipendra Singh Airee, Lalit Narayan Rajbanshi, and Gulshan Jha claimed three wickets each while Kushal Malla and Abinash Bohara also took a wicket apiece.

Nepal began their 2025 Asia Cup campaign with a hard-fought five-wicket victory over Malaysia in their opening match of the series at the Al Amerat Cricket Ground in Al Amerat, Oman on Friday.

Chasing 144, the defending champions Nepal achieved the target in 19.2 overs losing five wickets, but had to survive some scare from the Malaysians late in the innings.

full_article:
Nepal batsman Dipendra Singh Airee became just the third man to hit six sixes in one over in an international T20 match when he achieved the feat against Qatar in Al Amerat on Saturday. Dipendra Singh Airee

He joins India's Yuvraj Singh, who made his runs off England's Stuart Broad in Durban in the 2007 World Cup, and West Indies all-rounder Kieron Pollard who hammered Sri Lanka's Akila Dananjaya in Antigua in 2021.

South Africa's Herschelle Gibbs and USA's Jaskaran Malhotra have achieved the feat in one-day international cricket while no one has ever done it in Test cricket.

Airee was on 28 from 15 balls, and Nepal on 174 for 7, when medium pacer Kamran Khan began the final over of the innings in the ACC Men's Premier Cup match.

The next six deliveries were all deposited over the ropes as Airee finished on 64 not out from 21 balls.

Nepal, who will appear in their second T20 World Cup later this year in West Indies and USA, closed on 210 for 7 which was enough to beat Qatar by 32 runs.

It was the second time that Airee, 24, has hit six successive sixes.

He achieved it against Mongolia in their Asian Games meeting in Hangzhou in September, but on that occassion the six sixes were spread across two overs.

Nepal begin their T20 World Cup against the Netherlands in Dallas on June 4. They will also play group games against South Africa, Sri Lanka and Bangladesh.
